scenarios.scenario: Receiving unsolicited images or videos of children
recommendations: Immediately report the incident to law enforcement, such as your local police station or the cybercrime cell.
Do not download, save, or share the material under any circumstances, as this is illegal.
Preserve all evidence, including sender details and message content, for investigation.
Report the content anonymously via the Aarambh India Internet Hotline (aarambhindia.org/report) or call the CHILDLINE 1098 helpline for guidance and support.
If you are unsure, consult with the National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) or your State Commission for Protection of Child Rights for further assistance.

scenarios.scenario: Witnessing child pornography online
recommendations: Report the website or content immediately to the platform, cybercrime authorities, or via the Aarambh India Internet Hotline (aarambhindia.org/report).
Call the CHILDLINE 1098 helpline to seek guidance on next steps.
Take screenshots or note down URLs as evidence, but do not share or distribute the content.
Do not interact with the content or the individuals involved.

scenarios.scenario: Being solicited to create or distribute child pornography
recommendations: Refuse all contact and block the individual immediately.
Report the approach to your nearest police station or cybercrime cell, as well as on the Aarambh India Internet Hotline.
Save all messages or communication attempts as evidence for authorities.
Seek legal counsel and support from child protection organizations if needed.

scenarios.scenario: Discovering child pornography on a family member’s device
recommendations: Secure the device to prevent deletion or tampering with evidence.
Report the situation to your local police station or cybercrime cell immediately.
Contact CHILDLINE 1098 or your State Commission for Protection of Child Rights for further guidance.
Consult with legal counsel to understand your responsibilities and protect the child’s interests.

scenarios.scenario: Finding or seeing concerning images of a child online
recommendations: Report the images to the website or platform and to the Aarambh India Internet Hotline.
Inform law enforcement or the cybercrime cell for prompt action.
Take screenshots or note down the URLs as evidence, without sharing the content.
If the child is known, sensitively inform their parents or guardians and offer support.

scenarios.scenario: Exposure to child pornography accidentally
recommendations: Close the content immediately and clear your browsing data.
Report the incident to the website/platform and, if needed, to the Aarambh India Internet Hotline.
Call CHILDLINE 1098 if you feel distressed or need further guidance.
Ensure your device has updated antivirus software to prevent future exposure.

scenarios.scenario: Receiving suspicious links to harmful sites
recommendations: Do not click on suspicious or unknown links.
Report the message to the platform or sender’s service provider.
Use spam filters and security tools to block unwanted or dangerous messages.
Keep your antivirus and security software updated.

scenarios.scenario: Children being approached by strangers online
recommendations: Educate children about the risks of interacting with strangers on the internet, using resources from NCPCR or Aarambh India.
Instruct children never to share personal information online.
Use parental control software to monitor and restrict access to questionable sites.
Encourage open dialogue so children feel comfortable reporting suspicious interactions.

scenarios.scenario: Concerns about children’s online friendships or exposure to inappropriate content
recommendations: Monitor your child’s online friends and review their social media profiles regularly.
Get to know your child’s friends and their parents to build a trusted support network.
Encourage your child to avoid conversations or interactions that make them uncomfortable.
Block and report any inappropriate content or contacts to the relevant platforms and authorities.

scenarios.scenario: Child pornography promotion in chat rooms or forums
recommendations: Report the chat room or forum to the hosting platform and to the Aarambh India Internet Hotline.
Inform law enforcement or the cybercrime cell with detailed information about the platform and activities.
Preserve evidence such as screenshots or logs without engaging with participants.

scenarios.scenario: Suspected online abuse of a child
recommendations: Report suspected abuse or exploitative images to the website/platform and to law enforcement or the cybercrime cell.
Capture evidence carefully without distributing or sharing the content.
Inform the child’s parents or guardians and offer support.
Call CHILDLINE 1098 or contact NCPCR for additional guidance.

scenarios.scenario: Someone requesting nude images from you or your child
recommendations: Report the user to the platform administrators and block them immediately.
Delete all related messages to avoid accidental sharing.
Inform a trusted adult, parent, or teacher for guidance and support.
If you feel threatened, contact the police or CHILDLINE 1098.

scenarios.scenario: Child addicted to pornography
recommendations: Have open and honest conversations with your child about the risks and consequences of pornography.
Limit their access to technology and monitor their online activity.
Seek professional counseling or therapy, preferably with a counselor experienced in child issues.
Contact CHILDLINE 1098 or local child protection organizations for support.

scenarios.scenario: Dealing with peer pressure online
recommendations: Encourage children to stand firm in their values and beliefs.
Advise them to talk to a trusted adult if they feel pressured or uncomfortable.
Educate them about the risks of participating in harmful online activities.
Support them in avoiding situations that compromise their safety.

scenarios.scenario: Encountering something online that feels wrong or unsafe
recommendations: Discuss the content with a trusted adult or counselor for perspective and support.
Report suspicious or harmful content to the website/platform and, if necessary, to law enforcement.
Avoid sharing or forwarding the material to prevent further harm.
Do not click on any suspicious links associated with the content.

scenarios.scenario: Receiving unwanted and persistent messages online
recommendations: Block the sender immediately to prevent further contact.
Save all messages as evidence for potential legal action.
Report the user to the social media platform or messaging service.
If the harassment escalates or threatens your safety, contact local police or cybercrime cell.

scenarios.scenario: Discovering someone is tracking your online activity
recommendations: Change passwords for all your online accounts promptly.
Enable two-factor authentication on all platforms for added security.
Review and tighten your privacy settings on social media and other accounts.
Install trusted anti-spyware and antivirus software to detect and remove tracking tools.

scenarios.scenario: A former partner is harassing you online
recommendations: Document every instance of harassment, including screenshots and timestamps.
Consider obtaining a restraining order under the Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act or relevant IPC sections.
Report the harassment to the platform or your internet service provider (ISP).
Seek emotional support or counseling from trusted professionals or organizations like the National Commission for Women (NCW).

scenarios.scenario: Someone is impersonating you online

Inform your contacts about the impersonation to prevent misinformation.
File a complaint with the cybercrime cell under the IT Act, 2000.
Monitor your financial and personal accounts for any suspicious activity.

scenarios.scenario: Receiving threats or intimidation online

Save all threatening messages and communications as evidence.
Block the sender to stop further contact.
Seek emotional support from family, friends, or professional counselors.

Report the harassment to the social media platform where you met the person.
Alert your family and close friends about the situation for support and safety.
Avoid being alone in vulnerable places and consider changing your routines.

scenarios.scenario: Worried your personal information has been leaked online

Change all your passwords and enable two-factor authentication.
Inform your bank and update your financial information to prevent fraud.
File a complaint with the platform where the leak occurred.

scenarios.scenario: Constant harassment related to your pictures online

Block the user to prevent further contact.
Set your profile and photo albums to private to restrict access.
Inform trusted family or friends about the harassment for support.

scenarios.scenario: Someone you know is creating multiple fake accounts impersonating you

Inform your close contacts to prevent misinformation or misuse.

scenarios.scenario: Someone from your past is reaching out online and making you uncomfortable

Consider tightening your social media privacy settings or deleting accounts if necessary.

Inform your contacts about the breach to avoid spreading misinformation.

scenarios.scenario: A minor is contacted about a job opportunity

Avoid sharing any personal or sensitive information.
Report any inappropriate or suspicious communication to law enforcement.
Be cautious as minors are often targeted for exploitation.

scenarios.scenario: Asked to send sensitive documents such as Aadhaar or PAN card
recommendations: Verify the employer’s authenticity before sharing any sensitive documents.
If unsure, cut off contact and research more about the company.
Consult parents or trusted adults before sharing important documents.
Report suspicious requests to the job portal and cybercrime authorities.

scenarios.scenario: Receiving a call claiming to be from your bank requesting your ATM PIN

Call your bank directly using the number on your official bank statements or website to verify the call.
Report the incident to your bank’s fraud department and local cybercrime authorities.

Run a full scan with your antivirus software.

Report the call to the National Cyber Crime Reporting Portal and consumer protection agencies.

scenarios.scenario: Receiving a call about suspicious activity on your credit card, requesting your card number for verification

Never provide your card number or CVV to an unverified caller.

scenarios.scenario: Receiving an email claiming your bank account has been compromised, requesting you to verify your login details

scenarios.scenario: Receiving an urgent email claiming you have won a lottery or prize, needing to pay a fee to claim it
recommendations: Be extremely cautious, as this is a common scam tactic.

Check your account settings and security preferences through the official platform.

scenarios.scenario: Trusted account contacts you online and asks for personal information

If the request seems suspicious, report the account to the platform as potentially compromised.
Inform your contacts about the phishing attempt to prevent them from falling victim.

scenarios.scenario: Seeing something online that seems too good to be true

Stay vigilant and protect your personal information from potential harm.

Report the phishing email to your bank's fraud department and the Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In).

Monitor your credit card statements regularly and enable transaction alerts to detect any suspicious activity promptly.

Contact local law enforcement or cybercrime authorities to report the suspicious activity.
Report the suspicious account or contact to the platform or service provider.

scenarios.scenario: Receiving fake emails or SMS messages from seemingly legitimate companies
